results.abstract: plans tentative extension of Maj L G Cooper Apr flight from 18 to 22 orbits, extending flight time from 22 to 34 hrs; USSR space gains linked; water supply to control capsule heat is limiting factor in flight length

headline.main: Cooper Scheduled To Orbit 22 Times; 22-ORBIT FLIGHT PROJECTED BY U.S. Water Supply Holds Key

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2-- The space agency is tentatively planning to extend the duration of the next Mercury astronaut flight to 34 hours--10 hours longer than originally contemplated.

byline.original: By JOHN W. FINNEY Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2-- The space agency is tentatively planning to extend the duration of the next Mercury astronaut flight to 34 hours--10 hours longer than originally contemplated.

results.snippet: The year 1962 will be remembered for a number of spectacular developments in science. The most dramatic in popular appeal were made in space by the United States and Russia.
results.lead_paragraph: The year 1962 will be remembered for a number of spectacular developments in science. The most dramatic in popular appeal were made in space by the United States and Russia.

results.abstract: Comdr Schirra hopeful that rendezvous of spacecraft in orbit can be fairly easily achieved, rept to NASA on his '62 orbital flight

headline.main: SCHIRRA IS HOPEFUL ON A SPACE LINK-UP

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24 (AP) --Cmdr. Walter M. Schirra Jr. says it should be fairly easy for a space pilot to achieve rendezvous with another craft in orbit if he could do so in a leisurely manner.
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24 (AP) --Cmdr. Walter M. Schirra Jr. says it should be fairly easy for a space pilot to achieve rendezvous with another craft in orbit if he could do so in a leisurely manner.

headline.main: AN 18-ORBIT FLIGHT IS LIKELY ON APRIL 12

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (AP) --Gordon Cooper, the astronaut may begin his orbital flight, the longest and perhaps the last in "Project Mercury," on April 2.
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (AP) --Gordon Cooper, the astronaut may begin his orbital flight, the longest and perhaps the last in "Project Mercury," on April 2.
